answers.text: to write of a decline of the Ottoman Empire

qas.question: What was always in question from the beginning of the Ottoman Empire?
What was the Ottoman Empire created from?

answers.text: the lands of the former eastern Roman Empire

qas.question: How did the last Roman emperor die?
Where was the Roman emperor's capital?

context: It has pleased western historians <a0_0>to write of a decline of the Ottoman Empire<a0_0/> as though a stable and uncontested polity of that name once existed. <a1_0>The borders<a1_0/> did expand and contract but they were always dynamic and always in "question" right from the beginning. The Ottoman Empire was created from <a2_0>the lands of the former eastern Roman Empire<a2_0/> on the occasion of the latter's violent demise. The last Roman emperor died <a3_0>fighting hand-to-hand in the streets<a3_0/> of his capital, <a4_0>Constantinople<a4_0/>, overwhelmed by the Ottoman military, in May, 1453. The victors inherited his remaining territory in the Balkans.
